docs.snippet: Alberto Nisman, who is investigating the 1994 bombing of a Jewish center, said Iran had set up intelligence stations in Latin America to carry out terrorist attacks directly or through Hezbollah.
docs.lead_paragraph: Alberto Nisman, who is investigating the 1994 bombing of a Jewish center, said Iran had set up intelligence stations in Latin America to carry out terrorist attacks directly or through Hezbollah.
docs.abstract: Alberto Nisman, special prosecutor investigating 1994 bombing of Jewish community center in Buenos Aires that killed 85 people, releases report claiming that Iran had set up intelligence stations in different parts of Latin America with aim of carrying out terrorist attacks directly or through Hezbollah, powerful Lebanese militant group.

headline.seo: Prosecutor in Argentina Says Iran Plotted With Hezbollah in Latin America
headline.main: Prosecutor in Argentina Sees Iranian Plot in Latin America
headline.print_headline: Prosecutor In Argentina Sees Iran Plot

docs.snippet: In a 4-to-1 ruling, El Salvador’s highest court said that “the rights of the mother cannot be privileged over those” of the fetus. But the woman’s lawyer described the decision as “misogynistic.”
docs.lead_paragraph: In a 4-to-1 ruling, El Salvador’s highest court said that “the rights of the mother cannot be privileged over those” of the fetus. But the woman’s lawyer described the decision as “misogynistic.”
docs.abstract: El Salvador’s highest court denies appeal from woman with high-risk pregnancy to be allowed to undergo abortion, upholding country’s strict law banning abortion under any circumstances.

headline.seo: Salvadoran Court Denies Abortion to Ailing Woman
headline.main: Salvadoran Court Denies Abortion to Ailing Woman
headline.print_headline: Salvador Court Denies Abortion to Ailing Woman, Citing Strict Prohibition

byline.contributor: Karla Zabludovsky reported from Mexico City, and Gene Palumbo from San Salvador. Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting from Mexico City.
byline.original: By KARLA ZABLUDOVSKY and GENE PALUMBO

docs.snippet: The case of a sick woman in El Salvador who had been denied an abortion has convulsed the region, which is known for having some of the world’s most stringent abortion laws.
docs.lead_paragraph: The case of a sick woman in El Salvador who had been denied an abortion has convulsed the region, which is known for having some of the world’s most stringent abortion laws.
docs.abstract: Memo from Latin America; Caesarean section that ended high-risk pregnancy of El Salvadoran woman known as Beatriz raises question of whether doctors who performed operation managed to terminate pregnancy without violating country's strict anti-abortion law; Beatriz had been denied an abortion by country's courts; law, while stringent, is also vague and open to interpretation.

headline.seo: Woman Who Sought Abortion in El Salvador Delivers Baby
headline.main: A High-Risk Pregnancy Is Terminated. But Was It an Abortion?
headline.print_headline: A High-Risk Pregnancy Is Terminated. But Was It an Abortion?

docs.snippet: Despite hints in Latin America about legalizing marijuana, a summit meeting revealed much opposition to loosening drug laws, and little consensus.
docs.lead_paragraph: Despite hints in Latin America about legalizing marijuana, a summit meeting revealed much opposition to loosening drug laws, and little consensus.
docs.abstract: News analysis; summit meeting of the Organization of American States reveals much opposition to loosening drug laws, despite hints in Latin America about legalizing marijuana; there is little consensus over issue of legalizing marijuana, and public opinion polls in region generally show disapproval for plans.

headline.seo: In Americas, Resistance to Legal Marijuana
headline.main: In Americas, Resistance to Legal Marijuana
headline.print_headline: In Americas, Resistance to Legal Marijuana

docs.snippet: Nigeria made nine changes to their squad for the Confederations Cup from the one that won the African Nations Cup in February as coach Stephen Keshi continued his policy of promoting inexperienced youngsters on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nigeria made nine changes to their squad for the Confederations Cup from the one that won the African Nations Cup in February as coach Stephen Keshi continued his policy of promoting inexperienced youngsters on Friday.

headline.main: Nigeria Make Nine Changes in Squad for Confederations Cup
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Make Nine Changes in Squad for Confederations Cup

docs.snippet: This month's Confederations Cup is far more than just a straight dress rehearsal for next year's World Cup finals because nothing is straightfoward as far as football in Brazil is concerned.
docs.lead_paragraph: This month's Confederations Cup is far more than just a straight dress rehearsal for next year's World Cup finals because nothing is straightfoward as far as football in Brazil is concerned.

headline.main: Confederations Cup More Than a Dress Rehearsal for Brazil
headline.print_headline: Confederations Cup More Than a Dress Rehearsal for Brazil

docs.snippet: Uruguay's mood going into the Confederations Cup will depend on whether they have done their homework for the crucial World Cup qualifier in Venezuela four days before the tournament kicks off.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's mood going into the Confederations Cup will depend on whether they have done their homework for the crucial World Cup qualifier in Venezuela four days before the tournament kicks off.

headline.main: Uruguay Go Back to School at Confederations Cup
headline.print_headline: Uruguay Go Back to School at Confederations Cup

docs.snippet: Nigeria, already hampered by injuries, will arrive in Brazil for the Confederations Cup feeling travel weary after a punishing schedule as they prepare to fly the flag for African football.
docs.lead_paragraph: Nigeria, already hampered by injuries, will arrive in Brazil for the Confederations Cup feeling travel weary after a punishing schedule as they prepare to fly the flag for African football.

headline.main: Nigeria Battle Fatigue Before Confederations Cup
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Battle Fatigue Before Confederations Cup

docs.snippet: Tahiti will take their place on football's world stage for the first time at the Confederations Cup in Brazil this month - but it won't be their last because in September the Pacific Ocean island is hosting FIFA's Beach Soccer World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Tahiti will take their place on football's world stage for the first time at the Confederations Cup in Brazil this month - but it won't be their last because in September the Pacific Ocean island is hosting FIFA's Beach Soccer World Cup.

headline.main: Tahiti Happy to Be on Football's World Stage-Twice
headline.print_headline: Tahiti Happy to Be on Football's World Stage-Twice

docs.snippet: Manchester United have reached an agreement to sign promising young defender Guillermo Varela from Uruguay's Club Atletico Penarol, the Premier League champions said on Friday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester United have reached an agreement to sign promising young defender Guillermo Varela from Uruguay's Club Atletico Penarol, the Premier League champions said on Friday.

headline.main: Man United Agree to Sign Uruguayan Defender Varela
headline.print_headline: Man United Agree to Sign Uruguayan Defender Varela
